alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued April 22 at 8:51AM CDT until April 23 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CDT SUNDAY... ...THIS MORNING`S FREEZE WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 22 to 29 degrees expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central, east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 9 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Not only will temperatures tonight into Sunday morning drop farther below freezing compared to last night, but much lighter winds will also promote widespread frost development in some places.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
